Best Printer Rentals for Remote Work

June 30, 2025 Marga Enterprises

In the age of hybrid schedules and home-based offices, remote work is here to stay. And while many professionals have adjusted their workstations with laptops, ergonomic chairs, and stable internet, one office essential often overlooked is the printer.

Whether you're printing contracts, shipping labels, client presentations, or personal documents, having a reliable printer at home is a must. But buying one outright isn‚Äôt always the most cost-effective‚Äîor eco-friendly‚Äîoption.

That‚Äôs where printer rentals come in. In this post, we‚Äôll walk you through the Best Printer Rentals for Remote Work, what to look for, and how to choose a provider that matches your workflow and values.

Why Rent a Printer for Remote Work?

Here are a few reasons why renting a printer is a smart move for remote professionals and home-based businesses:

  • Cost-Effective: Avoid high upfront costs of purchasing and maintaining a printer.

  • Scalability: Choose a printer based on current volume needs, and upgrade or downgrade anytime.

  • No Maintenance Worries: Rental companies usually include support and maintenance in the package.

  • Eco-Friendly Options: Many providers now offer energy-efficient and sustainable printer models.

Let‚Äôs explore the key features to consider when renting a printer‚Äîand the top providers that meet these needs.

What to Look for in a Printer Rental for Home Offices

1. Compact but Capable

Space is limited in most home offices, so look for a compact printer that doesn‚Äôt compromise on functionality. Multi-function printers (MFPs) that can print, scan, and copy are great for saving space and getting more done.

2. Wireless Connectivity

A remote setup demands flexibility. Make sure your rental printer supports Wi-Fi, mobile printing (like AirPrint or Google Cloud Print), and cloud services like Dropbox or Google Drive.

3. Fast Print Speeds and High-Quality Output

If you're printing presentations or reports for clients, speed and print quality matter. Aim for at least 20-30 pages per minute (ppm) and high-resolution printing (600 dpi and above).

4. Eco-Friendly Certifications

Working remotely doesn‚Äôt mean you should ignore your environmental footprint. Many rental printers are now Energy Star certified or meet eco-label requirements for sustainability.

Final Thoughts: Choosing the Best Printer Rentals for Remote Work

Remote work is more than a temporary shift‚Äîit‚Äôs a new normal. And having the right equipment makes all the difference. The Best Printer Rentals for Remote Work are those that balance:
